examples.text: Bunlar medeni milletlerin lügat kitaplarına süs olsun diye yazılmış fantazyalı kof lakırtılardır.
examples.translation: These are the fanciful, empty words of civilised nations, written in dictionaries for ornamental use.

etymology: From Ottoman Turkish قوف (kof), ultimately from Proto-Turkic *kobu- (“hollow, cavity”). Cognate with Old Turkic [script needed] (koɣï), [script needed] (kowï, “empty, hollow”), Karakhanid [script needed] (qowï, “empty, rotten”), Kyrgyz коо (koo, “hollow”), etc.
